info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDowell, east central Buncombe and southeastern Yancey Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southwest of Marion, or 5 miles southwest of Old Fort, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Fort, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Black Mountain, Montreat, Pleasant Gardens and Busick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
